availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, coal boatman. Washington, D. C., native. Resident of Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1856. Accused of assaulting Mrs. Nancy Brown in Jefferson County in August 1856. Coal boatman in Louisville in 1860. Imprisoned in the Jefferson County Jail for a misdemeanor by the Jefferson Circuit Court in May 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 2, p. 570.
"Assault on Woman - Peace Warrant," Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), August 9, 1856, p. 1.
KYR-0001-029-0064.
KYR-0001-029-0081.
